INDICATOR_NAME: Getting electricity: Price of electricity (US cents per kWh) (DB16-20 methodology)
SOURCE_NOTE: The price of electricity is measured in U.S. cents per kWh. A monthly electricity consumption is assumed, for which a bill is then computed for a warehouse based in the largest business city of the economy for the month of March. The bill is then expressed back as a unit of kWh. The index is computed based on the methodology in the DB16-20 studies.
